sections.text: Once wudu’ has been properly made, one proceeds to pray ṣalāh, which is composed of units called rak‘ahs. Each rak‘ah follows the same sequence of movements and recitations:

items: Standing (Qiyām) – Begin in an upright position.
Takbīr – Say “Allāhu akbar” to enter the prayer.
Recitation (Qirā’ah) – Recite Sūrat al‑Fātiḥah, then a portion of the Qur’ān.
Tashahhud (in final rak‘ah) – Sit and recite the testimony before concluding.

sections.text: To understand the steps of the ṣalāh it is important to understand that the prayer is made up of rak‘ahs, or units of prayer. Every rak‘ah has the same basic steps within it.

items: There will be a part when you are standing
A part when you recite from the Qur’an
A part when you bow down
A part where you prostrate (make sujud)
Fajr (2 rak‘ah): Both rak‘ahs recited aloud—Fātiḥah + another sūrah.
Dhuhr (4 rak‘ah): All silent—Rakah 1–2: Fātiḥah + another sūrah; Rakah 3–4: Fātiḥah only.
Maghrib (3 rak‘ah): Rakah 1–2 aloud: Fātiḥah + another sūrah; Rakah 3 silent: Fātiḥah only.
‘Isha’ (4 rak‘ah): Rakah 1–2 aloud; Rakah 3–4 silent (same pattern as Maghrib).

sections.text: Let us break down how each rak‘ah of the ṣalāh is performed, step by step.
We first began the prayer by making an intention from the heart to pray to Allah. As soon as you begin, your entire focus should be on the prayer itself and nothing else.

Raise your hands to your ears and say “Allahu Akbar”.

The moment you say “Allahu Akbar” the prayer officially begins. From this point forward you should focus wholeheartedly on the prayer and ignore all distractions.

Fun Fact: In Arabic, “Allahu Akbar” literally means “Allah is Greater,” reminding you in prayer that Allah is greater than all other thoughts and actions.

Lower your hands and place them over your navel. Your right hand should be placed over your left hand. Keep your eyes focused on the ground in front of you. Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said that while praying your eyes should always look to where you will prostrate.

Recite the opening chapter of the Qur’an, “Surah Al‑Fātiḥah.” After reciting Surah Al‑Fātiḥah, you may recite another chapter from the Qur’an. At a minimum you must recite Surah Al‑Fātiḥah in every rak‘ah of prayer.

Bow down (Ruku‘). As you are bowing, say “Allahu Akbar.” Keep your back straight, hands on your knees, and eyes on the ground where you will prostrate. In this position say three times: “Subḥāna Rabī al‑‘Aẓīm” (“How perfect is my Lord, the Magnificent”).

Return to standing. As you rise from Ruku‘, raise your hands to your ears and say “Samiʿa Allāhu liman ḥamidah” (“Allah hears those who praise Him”). Then lower your hands to your waist and say “Rabbana wa laka al‑ḥamd” (“Our Lord, to You is all praise”).

Go down to prostrate (Sujūd). As you move into this position say “Allahu Akbar,” and ensure your forehead, nose, palms, knees, and toes touch the ground. While in Sujūd say three times: “Subḥāna Rabī al‑‘Alā” (“How perfect is my Lord, the Most High”).

Rise from Sujūd and sit on your left leg (Tashahhud position). Say “Allahu Akbar.” Place your hands on your knees. It is recommended to ask Allah for forgiveness: “Rabbigh‑fir lī” (“O my Lord, forgive me”).
Return to Sujūd (second prostration) and say “Allahu Akbar.” While in Sujūd say three times: “Subḥāna Rabī al‑‘Alā.”
Arise from the second Sujūd to standing, saying “Allahu Akbar.” Congratulations—you have completed one full rak‘ah! After two rak‘ahs you will sit for Tashahhud instead of standing.

Perform the Tashahhud at the end of every two rak‘ahs. Sit on your legs, raise your right index finger, and say:

“At‑Taḥiyyātu li‑Llāhi wa‑ṣ‑Ṣalawātu wa‑ṭ‑Ṭayyibātu
As‑Salāmu ʿalayka ayyuhan‑nabiyyu wa raḥmatu Llāhi wa barakātuh
As‑Salāmu ʿalaynā wa ʿalā ʿibādillāhi ṣ‑ṣāliḥīn
Ash‑hadu allā ilāha illallāh wa ash‑hadu anna Muḥammadan ʿabduhu wa rasūluh”

In the last rak‘ah, after sitting for Tashahhud, add the Salawāt:

“Allahumma ṣalli ʿalā Muḥammadin wa ʿalā āli Muḥammad
Kamā ṣallayta ʿalā Ibrāhīma wa ʿalā āli Ibrāhīm
Innaka Ḥamīdun Majīd
Wa bārik ʿalā Muḥammadin wa ʿalā āli Muḥammad
Kamā bārakta ʿalā Ibrāhīma wa ʿalā āli Ibrāhīm
Innaka Ḥamīdun Majīd”

Then conclude the prayer with Taslīm:

Turn your head to the right and say “Assalāmu ʿalaykum wa raḥmatu Llāh”.
Turn your head to the left and repeat “Assalāmu ʿalaykum wa raḥmatu Llāh”.

items: Units (Rak‘ahs): Each ṣalāh consists of 2, 3, or 4 rak‘ahs, depending on the prayer.
Core steps per rak‘ah: Standing → Takbīr → Recitation → Ruku‘ → Sujūd → (Second Sujūd) → (If final rak‘ah, Tashahhud + Salawāt + Taslīm).
Final Tashahhud: In the last rak‘ah you sit for Tashahhud, send blessings (Salawāt), then conclude with Taslīm to both sides.
Combining rak‘ahs: Simply repeat the core sequence the required number of times, observing which rak‘ahs are recited aloud or silently as per each prayer’s ruling.
